title: restic serve --append-only allows overwriting files
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

The restic serve mode with `--append-only` allows overwriting files.

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

```
$ ./rclone -V
rclone v1.40-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1

$ git describe
v1.40-32-geca99b33
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux, amd64

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Local

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
$ ./rclone serve restic --append-only local:repo --verbose --verbose
```

Create a new file:

```
$ curl -H 'Accept: application/vnd.x.restic.rest.v2' -d 'foo' -i http://localhost:8080/data/file
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Server: rclone/v1.40-DEV
Date: Mon, 02 Apr 2018 08:22:47 GMT
Content-Length: 0

```

Check the file locally:

```
$ cat repo/data/fi/file
foo
```

Save the file again with different content:

```
$ curl -H 'Accept: application/vnd.x.restic.rest.v2' -d 'bar' -i http://localhost:8080/data/file
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Server: rclone/v1.40-DEV
Date: Mon, 02 Apr 2018 08:22:47 GMT
Content-Length: 0

```

File was updated:

```
$ cat repo/data/fi/file
bar
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2018/04/02 10:24:51 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.40-DEV" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "serve" "restic" "--append-only" "local:repo" "--verbose" "--verbose"]
2018/04/02 10:24:51 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/fd0/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/04/02 10:24:51 INFO  : Local file system at /home/fd0/shared/work/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/repo: Modify window is 1ns
2018/04/02 10:24:51 NOTICE: Local file system at /home/fd0/shared/work/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/repo: Serving restic REST API on http://localhost:8080/
2018/04/02 10:24:53 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/fd0/shared/work/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/repo: POST /data/file
2018/04/02 10:24:57 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/fd0/shared/work/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/repo: POST /data/file
2018/04/02 10:25:02 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/fd0/shared/work/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/repo: POST /data/file
```


#### Analysis

In append-only mode, the restic backend must not overwrite files. It's not something restic would regularly do, but the append-only mode should protect against attackers with access to the rclone server deleting backup data. In this case, deleting isn't possible (that's already prevented by rclone in append-only mode), but overwriting all files with e.g. empty files is possible.
